editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create itâ€”anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. Thatâ€™s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojangâ€™s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Swing, batta batta! Cheeky heckling and memorable stars make this remastered classic as fun as we remember.
Know the rules of poker? Get ready to break them in this brilliant roguelike deck-builder, which puts its own twist on the classic card game.

Ready for something a bit different? Plague Inc. challenges you to strategically spread and evolve diseases. While the concept isn't exactly honorable, the surprising ways all these novel gameplay systems interact make this twist on traditional heroism a lot of fun â€” even though it shouldnâ€™t be.

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win
The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Movingâ€™s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

editorialNotes.standard: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The solutions are as surreal as the landscapes in this curious hand-drawn adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Itâ€™s one thing to say youâ€™d never take a bribe: Itâ€™s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. Thatâ€™s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

An intriguing genre blend, Terraria mixes collection, construction, and combat in a retro-styled 2D adventure. Break apart the world, uncovering rare treasures and digging deep underground for resources to build elaborate houses. Then craft powerful weapons and armor before facing bizarre, fantastical creatures. Itâ€™s a huge, sophisticated experience thatâ€™s easy to spend hours withâ€”a universe of densely layered surprises, where every session is exciting.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic lightâ€”itâ€™s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstarâ€™s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.
What happens after a zombie apocalypse? Find out by intuitively rebuilding civilization in this slick sequel to Plague Inc.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Created by Ellen DeGeneres, this riotous game-night challenge reinvents charades for the app generation. Pick a category, then hold your device up to your head, screen facing outward, and guess the words using your friendsâ€™ clues. Several categories are included, with many more available as In-App Purchases. Best of all, you can record and share videos of your friendsâ€™ increasingly frantic efforts to clue you in. Heads Up! puts a fun, fast-paced party starter in your pocket.

name: Ticket to RideÂ® The Board Game

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains, and upgrading lines. Thereâ€™s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing subways come togetherâ€”and since no two games play alike, weâ€™re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

After a long day at work, itâ€™s bath time! But Swampyâ€™s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.Â

When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you donâ€™t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, itâ€™s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

Your starship is outgunned and on the run from a fleet of rebel forces; can you make it home alive? A space-combat experience of remarkable depth, FTL's elegant, interlocking gameplay systems generate moments of remarkable tension and reward. As your vessel leapfrogs between galaxies, youâ€™ll manage a crew, extinguish engine-room fires, target enemy shield generators with energy weapons, and equip powerful upgrades so you can plunge deeper into the uncharted cosmos. Itâ€™s a constant cycle of surprise and excitement, augmented by the gameâ€™s stylish presentation and irresistible charm.
Harvest crops of olives, grapes, and sorghum for the first time in this long-running sim series that lets you really dig into the details of virtual farming.

Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. Itâ€™s an outstanding return for Disneyâ€™s most beloved mascot.

ios.subtitle: Itâ€™s not a bug, itâ€™s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers weâ€™ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builderâ€™s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighborhoods of our own creation.
Awesome reaction emoji! Strategy-smashing Nope cards! The fur truly flies in this slick adaptation of the zany card game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With Party Pack 3 on Apple TV, weâ€™re gonna need a bigger living room. Fast-paced and irreverent, this multiplayer collection turns any gathering into a game show full of trivia questions, doodle showdowns, and offbeat challenges. Jackbox uses iPhones, iPads, and other devices as controllers, so everyone can play at once. Itâ€™s an easy and awesome way to get the gang together.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Smartly positioning fighters in this roguelike deckbuilder helps the gameplay shine as brightly as the flame youâ€™re tasked with defending.
Talk about a sticky situation! Build structures with all sorts of goo to stretch this long-awaited physics puzzling sequel to new heights.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Something happened to your fellow childrenâ€”and the only way to learn their fates is by sneaking past menacing shadows in this chilling 2D platformer.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This is not relaxing. This is not simple. But it is so, so good.
editorialNotes.tagline: Beware: this game has no mercy

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Got time on your hands? In this brilliant indie gem, spend 400 days (real ones!) seeking solitary diversions before your giant sleeping boss wakes up.

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!
editorialNotes.standard: Goofy banter, diverting puzzles, wall-to-wall actionâ€”we couldnâ€™t ask for more from a LEGO Ninjago game. Using the warriorsâ€™ trademark weapons and elemental moves, youâ€™ll battle the nefarious Ronin and his crew across Chenâ€™s Island, the Toxic Bogs, and other familiar settings. Even if youâ€™ve never seen the Masters of Spinjitzu animated series, these hilarious heroes and their kid-friendly shenanigans are guaranteed to win you over.

editorialNotes.tagline: Explore and survive a strange world
editorialNotes.standard: Just from reading the title, you know your objective. But as you explore amazing paper-cutout landscapes, youâ€™ll uncover a weird world dense with secrets and danger. Slick controls make traveling and harvesting food simple, but balancing your hunger and healthâ€”and sanityâ€”requires crafting weapons, traps, machines, and more. With tons of mysteries to uncover and challenges to complete, Donâ€™t Starve will keep you enthralled.
